title: EmPC-seq: Accurate RNA-sequencing and Bioinformatics Platform to Map RNA Polymerases and Remove Background Error
procedures: Prepare yeast cells for nuclear run-on assayInoculate a single yeast colony in 5 ml YEPD medium.Incubate overnight in a 30 °C incubator with the rotation speed set as 200 rpm.Measure the optical density (OD600nm) of each cell culture.Dilute and re-inoculate the yeast to 10 ml of YEPD medium with an OD600 of 0.2.Incubate the yeast cells in a 30 °C incubator until they reach an OD600 of 0.4-0.6.Yeast nuclear run-on assayCentrifuge the yeast cells at 2,000 × g for 5 min at 4 °C and draw off the supernatant.Wash the cell pellet with 5 ml of ice-cold DEPC-H2O by pipetting up and down.Re-centrifuge the yeast cells at 2,000 × g for 5 min at 4 °C and draw off the supernatant.Resuspend the cell pellet with 4.75 ml of ice-cold DEPC-H2O.Add 250 μl of 10% Sarkosyl solution and gently mix the solution.Hold on ice for 20 min.Centrifuge the yeast cells at 400 × g for 5 min at 4 °C and draw off the supernatant.Resuspend the cell pellet with 120 μl of 2.5× Transcription Buffer, 6 μl of 0.1 M DTT, 3.5 μl of each kind of 1 mM biotin-NTP, and 3 μl of RNase Inhibitor to a total volume as 143 μl.Add 142 μl DEPC-H2O and 15 μl of 10% Sarkosyl and gently mix the solution.Incubate the mixture at 30 °C for 5 min with gentle pipetting up and down at the half-time point (2.5 min).Nascent RNA extractionCentrifuge the reaction mixture at 400 × g for 5 min at 4 °C and draw off the supernatant.Quickly resuspend the pellet in 500 μl of Liquified phenol.Add 500 μl of AES Buffer and pipette up and down to rupture cells.Incubate the mixture at 65 °C for 5 min with vortex once every minute.Incubate the mixture on ice for 5 min.

Add 200 μl of chloroform to it and vortex for 30 s.Incubate the mixture at room temperature for 2 min.Centrifuge it at 14,000 × g for 5 min at 4 °C.Draw off the aqueous layer and put it into another new tubes (be careful to avoid the interface).Add 1 M sodium acetate solution to the aqueous layer to a final concentration of 200 mM.Split the aqueous RNA solution mixed with sodium acetate into two 1.5 ml tubes.Add 1 μl of GlycoBlueTM Coprecipitant and 3× volume of 100% ethanol into the two 1.5 ml tube containing aqueous layer in Step C11 (this mixture can be stored overnight).Centrifuge the mixture at 14,000 × g for 30 min at 4 °C and draw off the supernatant (be careful to avoid disturbing the blue pellet).Wash the pellet with freshly prepared RNase-free 75% ethanol.Centrifuge it at 14,000 × g for 5 min at 4 °C and draw off the supernatant.Let the pellet dry for 5 min and resuspend it in 20 μl of DEPC-H2O.RNA fragmentation by Base HydrolysisHeat denature the RNA solution at 65 °C for 40 s and place it on ice.Add 5μl of ice cold 1 N NaOH and incubate it on ice for 10 min.Add 25 μl of 1 M Tris-HCl (pH 6.8).Purify the RNA with Monarch® RNA Cleanup Kit (10 μg) with elution volume of 20 μl.Add 1 μl RNase inhibitor.Biotin-labeled nascent RNA pull-outWash 30 μl of Streptavidin M280 beads with 500 μl of beads washing buffer by adding and mixing the washing buffer with the beads, setting on a magnet for 1 min and drawing off the supernatant.Wash the beads twice with 500 μl of 100 mM NaCl solution, the operation is the same as Step E1.Resuspend the beads in 50 μl of binding washing buffer.

Mix the purified RNA in section D to 50 μl with binding washing buffer.Mix the RNA solution with the resuspended beads.Incubate the mixture at room temperature on a rotator for 20 min.Place the mixture on a magnet for 1 min and draw off the supernatant.Resuspend the beads in 500 μl of high salt washing buffer.Place the beads on a magnet for 1 min and draw off the supernatant.Repeat Steps E8-E10.Wash the beads twice with 500 μl of binding washing buffer.Wash the beads twice with 500 μl of low salt washing buffer.Resuspend the beads in 300 μl of TRIzolTM solution.Incubate the mixture on ice for 3 min.Add 60 μl of chloroform to the mixture and vortex it thoroughly for at least 20 s.Centrifuge the mixture at 20,000 × g for 5 min at 4 °C.Purify the RNA in the aqueous layer (be careful to avoid the interface) with Monarch® RNA Cleanup Kit (10 μg) with an elution volume of 20 μl.Cyclization of RNA sampleHeat denature the purified RNA at 65 °C for 1 min and place it on ice.Add the following reagents to 19 μl of the RNA solution: 4 μl of 10× T4 ligase I reaction buffer, 2 μl of T4 Ligase I enzyme, 2 μl of PNK enzyme, 1 μl of RNase inhibitor, 8 μl of 50% PEG8000 and 4 μl of 10 mM ATP solution.Incubate the mixture at 25 °C for 2 h or at 16 °C overnight.Purify the RNA in the mixture with Monarch® RNA Cleanup Kit (10 μg) with elution volume of 20 μl.Rolling-cycle reverse transcriptionAdd the following reagents to 9 μl of the RNA solution: 4 μl of 10mM dNTPs solution, 4 μl of 50 ng/μl Random Hexamers and 3 μl of RNase-free water.

Heat denature the reaction mix at 65 °C for 1 min and place it on ice for more than 2 min.Add the following materials into the reaction mix: 8 μl of 5× First-strand synthesis buffer, 4 μl of 0.1 mM DTT solution, 4 μl of SuperScript III enzyme and 8μl of waterNote: The buffers and enzymes used here are from SuperScriptTM III First-Strand Synthesis System Kit. Incubate the mixture at 25 °C for 10 min and then incubate at 42 °C for 20 min.Purify the RNA in the mixture with Monarch® RNA Cleanup Kit (10 μg) with an elution volume of 20 μl.Add 20 μl of RNase-free water to the RNA solution.Second strand synthesisAdd 38 μl of RNA solution with the following materials: 8 μl of 10× Second strand synthesis buffer, 4 μl of Second strand synthesis enzyme mix and 30 μl of RNase-free waterNote: The buffers and enzymes used here are from NEBNext® UltraTM II Directional RNA Second Strand Synthesis Module Kit. Incubate the reaction mix at 16 °C for 2 h with the thermocycler lid set at 50 °C.Purify the DNA in the mixture with the MinElute PCR Purification Kit.Library preparation and submitting for NGSMeasure the concentration of cDNA in step H3 by using QubitTM dsDNA HS Assay Kit.Prepare the sequencing library with the NEBNext® UltraTM II DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina® according to the manufacturer’s instructions by end preparation, adaptor ligation, size selection and PCR enrichment.Submit the cDNA library to MiSeq Illumina platform with read length as single-end 300 base pairs for performing Next Generation Sequencing.
